      • bindToPreparedStatement

        public static int bindToPreparedStatement(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement,
                                          java.lang.Object[] params)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Binds the parameters provided to the prepared statement.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to be bound to.
        params - The parameters to be bound.
        Returns:
        The number of items bound + 1, to be used when binding further parameters.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if PreparedStatement.setObject(int, java.lang.Object, int) fails.

      • bindToPreparedStatement

        public static int bindToPreparedStatement(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement,
                                          java.lang.Object[] params,
                                          int start)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Binds the parameters provided to the prepared statement, leaving those before start to remain bound as before. Iterates from start to start + params.length.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to be bound to.
        params - The parameters to be bound.
        start - The statement parameter index to start from.
        Returns:
        The number of items bound + 1, to be used when binding further parameters.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if PreparedStatement.setObject(int, java.lang.Object, int) fails.

      • addResultSetToTable

        public static Table addResultSetToTable(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement,
                                        Table table,
                                        SQLDataHandler handler,
                                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> keys)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addResultSetToTable

        public static Table addResultSetToTable(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                                        Table table,
                                        SQLDataHandler handler,
                                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> keys)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException

        Adds a database result set to a prefuse table using a prefuse SQL data handler. Uses the list of keys provided to determine whether to add a new row to the table for a particular row in the result set or whether to update an old row.

        If null is passed as the table, a new table is created and returned.

        Parameters:
        resultSet - The result set to add.
        table - The table to add to.
        handler - The prefuse SQL data handler to use to add the data.
        keys - A list of keys used to determine whether two rows are equivalent.
        Returns:
        A new table if none is provided, or the same table passed in if one is.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error in processing the result set.

      • createSchema

        public static Schema createSchema(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData metadata,
                                  SQLDataHandler handler)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a prefuse schema equivalent to the result set.
        Parameters:
        metadata - The metadata of the result set to create the schema from.
        handler - The prefuse SQL data handler which converts SQL data types to Java data types.
        Returns:
        A new prefuse schema.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the metadata cannot be processed.
